title: Decomposing cryptocurrency dynamics into recurring and noisy components. (arXiv:2306.17095v1 [q-fin.TR])
abstract: This paper investigates the temporal patterns of activity in the cryptocurrency market with a focus on bitcoin, ether, dogecoin, and winklink from January 2020 to December 2022. Market activity measures - logarithmic returns, volume, and transaction number, sampled every 10 seconds, were divided into intraday and intraweek periods and then further decomposed into recurring and noise components via correlation matrix formalism. The key findings include the distinctive market behavior from traditional stock markets due to the nonexistence of trade opening and closing. This was manifest in three enhanced-activity phases aligning with Asian, European, and US trading sessions. An intriguing pattern of activity surge in 15-minute intervals, particularly at full hours, was also noticed, implying the potential role of algorithmic trading. translated_title: 将加密货币动态分解为重复和噪声成分的研究
translated_abstract: 本文研究了加密货币市场的时间模式，重点关注比特币、以太坊、狗狗币和Winklink从2020年1月到2022年12月的情况。通过相关矩阵形式将市场活动指标——对数收益、成交量和交易数量，每10秒采样一次，分为日内和周内周期，然后进一步分解为重复和噪声成分。主要发现包括与传统股票市场不同的市场行为，因为没有交易开放和关闭。这表现为三个增强活动阶段，分别与亚洲、欧洲和美国的交易时段相一致。还注意到了在15分钟间隔内出现的活动激增的有趣模式，尤其在整点时出现，暗示了算法交易的潜在作用。最重要的是，发现比特币和以太坊的重复活动突发与美国重大宏观经济报告发布时间重合。
tldr: 本文研究了加密货币市场的时间模式，发现与传统股票市场不同的市场行为，表现为三个增强活动阶段与不同时段的交易时段相一致。在15分钟间隔内出现了活动激增的有趣模式，尤其在整点时出现，暗示了算法交易的潜在作用。此外，比特币和以太坊的重复活动突发与美国重大宏观经济报告发布时间相一致。
en_tdlr: This paper investigates the temporal patterns of activity in the cryptocurrency market, revealing distinct market behavior compared to traditional stock markets. It identifies three enhanced-activity phases aligning with different trading sessions and observes an intriguing pattern of activity surge in 15-minute intervals, potentially indicating the role of algorithmic trading. Most notably, recurring bursts of activity in bitcoin and ether coincide with the release times of significant US macroeconomic reports.
